chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
Q: code
j: nat
i: nat
r: list X
l: list X
a: list X

Goal:
j = i + length l -> (i, l ++ a ++ r) <sc Q -> (j, a) <sc Q

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
subcode_right : forall (n m : nat) (l r : list X), n = m + length l -> (n, r) <sc (m, l ++ r)
subcode = fun P (Q : nat * list X) => let (i, li) := P in let (n, code) := Q in exists l r : list X, code = l ++ li ++ r /\ i = n + length l : code -> nat * list X -> Prop Arguments subcode _ _ /
subcode_app_invert_right : forall (j : nat) (Q1 Q2 : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1 ++ Q2) -> (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, Q1) \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (length Q1 + j, Q2)
subcode_app_end : forall P (n : nat) (l r : list X), P <sc (n, l) -> P <sc (n, l ++ r)
subcode_cons_invert_right : forall (j : nat) (J : X) (Q : list X) (i : nat) (I : X), (i, I :: nil) <sc (j, J :: Q) -> i = j /\ I = J \/ (i, I :: nil) <sc (S j, Q)
subcode_left : forall (n m : nat) (l r : list X), n = m -> (n, l) <sc (m, l ++ r)
list_an_app_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ r -> l = list_an a (length l) /\ r = list_an (a + length l) (length r)
Fin.weak : forall p : nat, (Fin.t ?m -> Fin.t ?n) -> Fin.t (p + ?m) -> Fin.t (p + ?n) where ?m : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- nat] ?n : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- nat]
VectorSpec.append_splitat : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n) (w : VectorDef.t ?A ?m) (vw : VectorDef.t ?A (?n + ?m)), VectorDef.splitat ?n vw = (v, w) -> vw = VectorDef.append v w where ?A : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- Type] ?n : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- nat] ?m : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- nat]
in_code_subcode : forall (i : nat) P, in_code i P -> exists a : X, (i, a :: nil) <sc P
VectorSpec.append_comm_cons : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n) (w : VectorDef.t ?A ?m) (a0 : ?A), VectorDef.cons ?A a0 (?n + ?m) (VectorDef.append v w) = VectorDef.append (VectorDef.cons ?A a0 ?n v) w where ?A : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- Type] ?n : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- nat] ?m : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- nat]
VectorSpec.eta : forall v : VectorDef.t ?A (S ?n), v = VectorDef.cons ?A (VectorDef.hd v) ?n (VectorDef.tl v) where ?A : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- Type] ?n : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- nat]
subcode_out_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> out_code i Q -> out_code i P
subcode_in_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X) (i : nat), P <sc Q -> in_code i P -> in_code i Q
subcode_trans : forall P (Q R : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> Q <sc R -> P <sc R
VectorDef.splitat : forall l0 r0 : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (l0 + r0) -> VectorDef.t ?A l0 * VectorDef.t ?A r0 where ?A : [X : Type Q : code i : nat j : nat a : list X l : list X r : list X |- Type]
subcode_cons_inj : forall (i : nat) (ρ δ : X) P, (i, ρ :: nil) <sc P -> (i, δ :: nil) <sc P -> ρ = δ
subcode_length_le : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> fst Q <= fst P /\ fst P + length (snd P) <= fst Q + length (snd Q)
app_length : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), length (l ++ l') = length l + length l'
subcode_length' : forall P (Q : nat * list X), P <sc Q -> length (snd P) <= length (snd Q)
list_split_length : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k <= length ll -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ length l = k}}
nth_split : forall (A : Type) (n : nat) (l : list A) (d : A), n < length l -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ nth n l d :: l2 /\ length l1 = n
Permutation.Permutation_app_inv_m : forall (A : Type) (l l1 l2 l3 l4 : list A), l1 ++ l ++ l2 ~p l3 ++ l ++ l4 -> l1 ++ l2 ~p l3 ++ l4
Permutation.Permutation_app_middle : forall (A : Type) (l l1 l2 l3 l4 : list A), l1 ++ l2 ~p l3 ++ l4 -> l1 ++ l ++ l2 ~p l3 ++ l ++ l4
partition_length : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l l1 l2 : list A), partition f l = (l1, l2) -> length l = length l1 + length l2
Permutation.Permutation_app_inv_l : forall (A : Type) (l l1 l2 : list A), l ++ l1 ~p l ++ l2 -> l1 ~p l2
list_app_inj : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X), length l1 = length l2 -> l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ r2 -> l1 = l2 /\ r1 = r2
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
subcode_start_in_code : forall P (Q : nat * list X), 0 < code_length P -> P <sc Q -> in_code (code_start P) Q
